questions.question_text:
A retail company is planning to upgrade their Windows 7 point-of-sale terminals to Windows 10.
You have been informed that the terminals should only be upgraded again after a minimum of five years. Your solution has to allow for the scheduling of upgrades and updates to be executed consistently for al devices, while also keeping costs to a minimum.
Which of the following is the servicing tool that you should use?

discussion.content:
Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) provides extensive control over Windows 10 updates and is natively available in the Windows Server operating system. In addition to the ability to defer updates, organizations can add an approval layer for updates and choose to deploy them to specific computers or groups of computers whenever ready.

The other options do not provide Windows as a service.

Selected Answer: B
B. Windows Server Update Services (WSUS)

Reasons:

Centralized Management: WSUS allows you to manage the distribution of updates released through Microsoft Update to computers in your network. This centralized management is ideal for ensuring all devices receive updates consistently.

Scheduling and Control: WSUS gives you control over which updates are deployed and when, ensuring that you can manage and schedule updates according to the company's needs.

Cost Efficiency: WSUS is included with Windows Server, making it a cost-effective solution for managing updates without requiring additional licensing or subscription costs.

The other options, while useful for different purposes, do not fit the specific requirement as closely:

Windows Autopilot: Primarily focused on the deployment and configuration of new devices rather than ongoing update management.
Microsoft Intune: A cloud-based management tool suitable for mobile device management (MDM) and mobile application management (MAM), which may include additional costs.
Azure AD Connect: Used for synchronizing on-premises directories with Azure AD, not for managing updates.

Selected Answer: B
Intune doesn't support Windows 7

Selected Answer: B
B. Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) is the servicing tool that should be used for scheduling upgrades and updates to be executed consistently for all devices. WSUS allows administrators to manage and distribute updates and upgrades to Windows-based computers on a corporate network. It can be used to deploy software updates, security patches, and service packs to Windows operating systems and Microsoft applications. WSUS can also be used to manage the deployment of feature updates, such as upgrading from Windows 7 to Windows 10. Using WSUS, the company can schedule the upgrade to Windows 10 for all the point-of-sale terminals and ensure that they receive updates and upgrades consistently for at least five years. This solution will keep costs to a minimum by automating the upgrade process and reducing the need for manual intervention.

discussion.content:
Microsoft 365 admin center currently supports the following type of billing accounts:

• Microsoft Online Services Program: This billing account is created when you sign up for a Microsoft 365 subscription directly.

• Microsoft Products & Services Agreement (MPSA) Program: This billing account is created when your organization signs an MPSA Volume Licensing agreement to purchase software and online services.

• Microsoft Customer Agreement: This billing account is created when your organization works with a Microsoft representative, an authorized partner, or purchases independently.

So the Correct Answer would be:
1 - Microsoft Online Services Program
2-Microsoft Products & Services Agreement (MPSA) Program
The last one should be The Microsoft Product and Service Agreement.
